unnormalised: **Builder Reviews: Are You Doing Your Homework Before Buying That Dream Home?**
normalised: Builder Reviews: Are You Doing Your Homework Before Buying That Dream Home?

unnormalised: Mumbai: Forget that vastu shastra consultation for a minute! These days, prospective homebuyers in India are increasingly relying on builder reviews before signing on the dotted line. A new trend sees buyers sharing their experiences online – good, bad, and ugly – about everything from construction quality to delivery timelines.
normalised: Mumbai: Forget that vastu shastra consultation for a minute! These days, prospective homebuyers in India are increasingly relying on builder reviews before signing on the dotted line. A new trend sees buyers sharing their experiences online – good, bad, and ugly – about everything from construction quality to delivery timelines.

unnormalised: Is the building 'bikaau' (saleable) but the builder unreliable? Websites like NoBroker and Housing.com are seeing a surge in reviews for builders like Godrej Properties and Tata Housing. Dr. Sharma from IIT-Bombay suggests checking independent forums too.
normalised: Is the building 'bikaau' (saleable) but the builder unreliable? Websites like NoBroker and Housing dot com are seeing a surge in reviews for builders like Godrej Properties and Tata Housing. Doctor Sharma from I I T-Bombay suggests checking independent forums too.

unnormalised: "Read the fine print, and more importantly, read the reviews!" says Priya Reddy, a recent homeowner in Bangalore. "My friend bought a flat from 'XYZ Builders' and regrets it. Delayed possession, poor construction – the works! I avoided that mistake after reading reviews."
normalised: "Read the fine print, and more importantly, read the reviews!" says Priya Reddy, a recent homeowner in Bangalore. "My friend bought a flat from 'X Y Z Builders' and regrets it. Delayed possession, poor construction – the works! I avoided that mistake after reading reviews."

unnormalised: Before you invest your hard-earned Rs. 50 Lakhs (or more!) in that shiny new 2BHK of 1000 sq ft in Gurgaon, do your due diligence. Check those reviews, talk to existing residents, and maybe even visit a completed project nearby within a 5 km radius. Your peace of mind (and your investment!) depends on it.
normalised: Before you invest your hard-earned rupees fifty lakhs (or more!) in that shiny new two B H K of one thousand square feet in Gurgaon, do your due diligence. Check those reviews, talk to existing residents, and maybe even visit a completed project nearby within a five kilometer radius. Your peace of mind (and your investment!) depends on it.
